info.game_comments:
2006 Celebrity Jeopardy! game 1.
From Radio City Music Hall in New York City.

(1, 1).clue: The skating rink was an experiment, as the space had been a failure for retailers within this building complex

(2, 1).clue: Well, chim chim cher-ee!  This musical about a flying nanny is flying onto Broadway

(3, 1).clue: He's Butt-Head's partner in the cartoon

(6, 1).clue: This partner of Stan Laurel was known for saying, "Here's another nice mess you've gotten me into"

(1, 2).clue: The 1924 Democratic National Convention went on for 14 days in the second incarnation of this building

(2, 2).clue: (Before the clue is given, Kate Reinders from the Broadway play Wicked helps with the clue.)"Popular /You're gonna be pop-u-lar /I'll teach you the proper ploys /When you talk to boys /Little ways to flirt and flounce--woww! /I'll show you what shoes to wear /How to fix your hair /Everything that really counts to be /Popular /I'll help you be pop-u-lar /You'll hang with the right cohorts /You'll be good at sports /Know the slang you gotta know /So let's start /'Cause you've got an awfully long way to go""Wicked" is based on a modern novel inspired by this classic L. Frank Baum book that took us "over the rainbow"

(3, 2).clue: Using this trademarked type of "board" might get you some answers from beyond

(6, 2).clue: This Sesame Streeter & his pal Ernie debuted in 1969 & Carson, have Kyan help him with that unibrow!

(1, 3).clue: This 1920s art deco skyscraper is decorated with chrome & radiator cap designs

(3, 3).clue: These "of the cross" include Veronica wiping the face of Jesus

(6, 3).clue: "My Friend Irma" was his 1949 film debut; he may have heard Jerry Lewis say, "Hey laaaaaaady!" a lot

(1, 4).clue: Frank Lloyd Wright intended for visitors to begin at the top & move downward through this art museum

(3, 4).clue: Precedes "regal" in the name of a popular whisky

(6, 4).clue: Before he played God, he ended shows with "Say good night, Gracie"

(1, 5).clue: Daniel Burnham had to work with a triangular plot where Broadway, 5th & 23rd meet, & he came up with this building

(3, 5).clue: The second planet from the sun

(6, 5).clue: His name had top billing on "Laugh-In"; look that up in your Funk & Wagnalls

(1, 1).clue: On Dec. 16, 1773 American patriots dumped 342 chests of tea into this city's harbor

(2, 1).clue: In 1954 Roger Bannister became the first person to do this in under 4 minutes

(3, 1).clue: A popular Christmas tune begins, "I saw Mommy kissing Santa Claus underneath" this "last night"

(4, 1).clue: She was First Lady from 1981 to 1989

(6, 1).clue: If you're on Cape Chelyuskin in this country, you'll have to cross the Vilkitsky Strait to get the the Arctic Ocean

(1, 2).clue: Abraham Lincoln died across the street from this theatre on April 15, 1865

(2, 2).clue: Move over Jack Palance!  Yvan de Weber of Switzerland holds the world record for these, 120 in 1 minute, 1-handed

(3, 2).clue: "One O'Clock Jump" was the theme song of this musical "Count" & his orchestra

(4, 2).clue: A friend of the Hardy Boys, she is a teenage detective herself

(6, 2).clue: The Cook Strait separates the North & South Islands of this kiwi country

(1, 3).clue: In May 1844 he sent a telegraph message using the code he'd also invented

(2, 3).clue: Put your hands together & do this, like Martha Gibson of the U.K., who at age 7 did it louder than anyone else

(3, 3).clue: "All My Rowdy Friends Are Comin' Over Tonight" was an award-winning video by this country star

(6, 3).clue: Named after Vitus Bering, the Bering Strait separates these 2 continents

(1, 4).clue: John Rolfe came to the new world to grow this cash crop; picking up Pocahontas was a bonus

(2, 4).clue: Alberto Hidalgo & his happy feet can tap 734 times a minute while performing this Spanish dance

(3, 4).clue: This song standard is subtitled "I Didn't Want to Do It"

(6, 4).clue: The Strait of Messina separates Italy from this "boot"able isle

(1, 5).clue: This president said fear itself is "nameless, unreasoning, unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts"

(2, 5).clue: One of the big talents at the 1936 Salzburg Music Festival was this "Sound of Music" family

(3, 5).clue: In 1955 Tennessee Ernie Ford sang, "You load" this much & "what do you get?  Another day older and deeper in debt"

(6, 5).clue: The Juan de Fuca Strait separates Washington State from this Canadian Island that shares its name with a B.C. city

(0, 0).clue: In 2006 the National Tennis Center in New York was renamed in her honor
